result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian F Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian F Bates is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian F Bates was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Brian F Bates was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brian F Bates in court.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Brian F Bates.  Attorney Frank John Remington in court for State of Wisconsin.

DCPS violation report; CT issues body only warrant
Atty Devonte Windham
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

2:36 PM Defendant Brian F Bates in court, in custody.  Attorney Stanley V. Woodard in court for Brian F Bates.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
